New Records: England's last four innings have ended in scores of 215, 170, 156 and 129.
England are the first team to lose five matches in a World Cup.
Key Match Events: England bowled out for 129 in 34.5 overs - Livingstone top-scores with 27
Willey takes 3-45 including Kohli for duck and Suryakumar for 49
Pre-Game Insights: Experts are questioning the England team's performance and Jos Buttler's returns with the bat in this tournament are 43, 29, 9, 15, 8 and 10.
Post-Match Reflections: England captain Jos Buttler: 'Very disappointing. At the halfway stage chasing 230 we fancied ourselves. But it's the same old story.'
India captain Rohit Sharma: 'This was a game that showed a lot of character in our squad. When times were tough, our experienced players stood up at the right time and fought for us.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The dew came down at what seemed like the perfect time for England, but they failed to capitalise on it.
Rohit Sharma referenced he had to have a Test mentality against Australia, soaked up the pressure and at that stage, that is what England needed.
Others: Matthew Mott has just got a little spiky in the press conference following two questions about Eoin Morgan's comments where the former England captain suggested'something must be going on' in the dressing room for England to have performed so badly.
